docs.abstract: The author, most recently, of “Blue” says Alex Haley was her mentor. “We both wrote late at night, and when my phone rang at 3 a.m., I always knew it was him, making sure I was working.”
docs.snippet: The author, most recently, of “Blue” says Alex Haley was her mentor. “We both wrote late at night, and when my phone rang at 3 a.m., I always knew it was him, making sure I was working.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The author, most recently, of “Blue” says Alex Haley was her mentor. “We both wrote late at night, and when my phone rang at 3 a.m., I always knew it was him, making sure I was working.”

headline.main: Perfume Review: Danielle by Danielle Steel
headline.print_headline: Scent Notes | Danielle by Danielle Steel

docs.lead_paragraph: I came to your house with a gun. At least imagine I did. I tied you to a chair, took a step back and repeatedly fired. But my arm twitched; every bullet missed. Meanwhile, you slipped your knots and fled.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry

docs.abstract: The seduction began with a flower, one perfect red silk rose. Then there were telephone calls, lots of telephone calls, and sweet notes. Chocolates followed, expensive, delicious chocolates, dragees dipped in gold flakes and luscious truffles. There were invitations to fancy parties, spur-of-the-moment visits and glossy you-can-trust-me photos.    All that you would expect in a storybook courtship can be found in the way that Eileen Goudge and her publisher, Viking, have been trying to romance reviewers, bookstore managers and readers to turn her into a commercial fiction writer with the stature and sales of Danielle Steel.
docs.lead_paragraph: The seduction began with a flower, one perfect red silk rose. Then there were telephone calls, lots of telephone calls, and sweet notes. Chocolates followed, expensive, delicious chocolates, dragees dipped in gold flakes and luscious truffles. There were invitations to fancy parties, spur-of-the-moment visits and glossy you-can-trust-me photos.

headline.main: Chasing the Success of Danielle Steel

docs.abstract: The writer, who has sold some 600 million books worldwide and lives in San Francisco and Paris, was made a “chevalier” of the Legion of Honor.
docs.snippet: The writer, who has sold some 600 million books worldwide and lives in San Francisco and Paris, was made a “chevalier” of the Legion of Honor.
docs.lead_paragraph: Danielle Steel joined the ranks of Douglas MacArthur, Julia Child, Walt Disney, Alan Greenspan and Bob Dylan on Wednesday when she became the latest American to receive France’s highest award, the Legion of Honor.

headline.main: Danielle Steel Awarded French Legion of Honor

docs.abstract: This week: conversations with the novelists John Irving and Danielle Steel; Motoko Rich with notes from the field; and Jennifer Schuessler with best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host. The interview with John Irving is also available as a video.
